summary: This bill, H.R. 5140, aims to lower the age at which a minor can be tried as an adult for certain criminal offenses in the District of Columbia. It amends existing sections of the District of Columbia Official Code related to family court jurisdiction and transfer to criminal proceedings, changing age thresholds from 16, 15, and 18 to 14. The bill, introduced by Mr. Gill of Texas, applies to offenses committed on or after the date of enactment.
